div.style: width: 260px; height: 400px; overflow: hidden; padding-left: 30px; margin-bottom: 15px;

p.span: The latest information regarding COVID 19 is shown below. Previous information can be found at the COVID 19 Information link on this page.
The scheduled Board meeting will be held on Tuesday April 21st virtually on YouTube via Zoom at 6:00 PM.
Thank you to all those who have assisted with our feeding program! The number of students we are serving continues to increase....we are glad our students are being fed!

Beginning next week....we will provide all 5 days of food on Mondays. We will have pick up/drive up on Monday, April 13th from 11 am-noon at Clanton Intermediate, Isabella, Jemison High, Maplesville, Thorsby and Verbena. We will continue feeding on Mondays until further notice.
JES Faculty and Staff video to students
CIS Faculty and Staff video to students

div.p: MHS Faculty and Staff video to students

p.span: IHS Faculty and Staff video to students
Our primary objective is the safety of our students, faculty/staff, admins and community......our hope is you will understand as well!

With the governors order to “stay at home”....we will delay the pick up of personal belongings until the order is lifted. Only medicine will be given out on Tuesday. All other personal belongings will be addressed after the “stay at home” order is lifted. Feedings will continue as planned and packets will be mailed out as scheduled.

span.span: Chilton County Schools encourages everyone to complete the census!

div.p: Chilton County Schools will be contacting each student to explain the plan moving forward for the remaining school year by Monday, April 6th. Students will be offered online learning or mailed learning packets for core courses. We will be offering teacher support and help each student along the way. The school calendar will remain as is and school will end on May 21st. If you have not been contacted by Monday, April 6th, please contact your student's school. Further information is available on the COVID 19 Information Link on this page. Thank you for your patience and we will work together to make the best of a difficult situation.

p.span: Chilton County School Closure Feeding Plan

div.p: During this time of closure, the schools that will be providing FREE meals are VHS, CIS, JHS, IHS, THS, MHS for those in need (18 years and under). Federal guidelines mandate children must be present to receive a meal. Meal must be consumed off site.

Program Details:
Dates: April 6- May 21, 2020
Pickup will be on Mondays &
Wednesdays 11:00 a.m.-12:00 p.m.
(Meals picked up on Monday will include lunch and snack for two days and meals picked up on Wednesday will include lunch and snack for three days) Excludes weekends

Tables will be set up at each of the schools that are designated above with signs ind icating where the food is located for pickup. This will be a drive through grab-n-go service where the chi ld(ren) will rece ive a lunch and snack to be eaten off site.

Student's Medication can be picked up at your student's school on Tuesday, April 7th between 8 am-3 pm. Please call your student's school and let them know you are coming and the school will bring it to your vehicle at the curb. An adult must pick up the medication. Medications will not be available for pickup after Tuesday, April 7th.

Student's Personal Items that your student needs can be picked up at that school on Tuesday, April 7th, Wednesday, April 8th or Thursday, April 9th between 8 am-3 pm. You must call the school and make an appointment to pick up your belongings. If you do not need the items right now, please wait and pick up those items when we return to school in the fall. We will have pick up dates before we return in August. I would encourage you to wait if you can.

p.span: Our plan is to still have Drivers Education during summer school if possible. If you would like to register for one of the summer sessions, you will need to print the Drivers Education Form located on the District Website and mail it and a money order for $200 to the CCBOE by May 1st, 2020. Forms will need to be mailed to 1705 Lay Dam Road, Clanton, AL 35045, Attention: Ashlie Harrison. If you have questions about Drivers Education, you may email Ashlie Harrison at aharrison@chiltonboe.com.
Graduations have been rescheduled for the following dates and locations:

div.p:
Chilton County High June 12th. Tiger Stadium
Isabella. June 12th Isabella
Jemison June 6th Panther Stadium
Maplesville June 9th Maplesville
Thorsby June 11th Thorsby
Verbena June 10th Jeff State-Clanton

Individual schools will schedule honor programs.
We will evaluate and reschedule if necessary on May 4th. We reserve the right to reschedule.
Proms will be rescheduled after June 5th. We reserve the right to reschedule or cancel. Principals will announce the reschedule or cancellation by May 4th.

p.br: Kindergarten Graduations will be rescheduled for the week of June 8th-12th. Each school will notify you of the date/time. We will evaluate and reschedule if necessary on May 4th. We reserve the right to reschedule.

p.span: The mission of the Chilton County School System is to provide a safe environment for challenging educational experiences which enables all students to succeed to their individual potential. This is a shared commitment of the students, parents, educators, and community members.
